availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Marcus Lafayette Bradford (Kenton County, Kentucky, tobacconist. Tried for murder of David McCullough)

body.p: Kenton County, Kentucky, tobacconist. Kenton County, Kentucky, native. Son of William Bradford and Mary Ann Mullins Bradford. Married to Sarah S. Jones Bradford. Resident of Kenton County, Kentucky, in 1850. Tobacconist in Kenton County in 1860. Accused of the murder of David McCullough in Kenton County in 1862.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Kenton County, Covington/Ward 2, p. 233B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Kenton County, Covington/Ward 2, p. 571.
"Lafayette Bradford," _ Louisville Journal_ (Louisville, KY), March 11, 1862, p. 3.
